extension.valueString: The patient that is to be used to pre-populate the form

item.text: What are the important things for you in this health check today?
Is there anything you are worried about?
Do you have any specific health goals? Is there anything in particular about your health and wellbeing that you would like to improve?
Other relevant medical history, operations, hospital admissions, etc

extension.valueString: Do you take any regular medications?

item.text: Do you take any regular medications (prescribed, over-the-counter, traditional, complementary and alternative)?
Up to date in the health record?
Medication understanding and adherence has been checked with patient
Regular medications: check if still required, appropriate dose, understanding of medication and adherence
Up to date in the health record?
Relevant family history (including diabetes, heart disease, cancer, mental health)
Have there been any particular stressful life events that are impacting on you/your health lately?
Consider conversation about social connection, which could include questions about sports/hobbies/clubs/other activities
Do you feel safe at home?
Work details (occupation including occupational hazards, study, training, disability, etc)
How have you been feeling lately?
If indicated, ask about depression (consider screening tools, eg aPHQ-9, K5 or K10) and complete risk assessment.
Explore other mental health concerns as indicated.
Do you have any worries about your diet or weight?

Document conversation about health eating which could include:
- current diet including food and drinks
- recommendations about fruit and vegetable intake, water as the main drink, avoiding sugary drinks, avoiding highly processed foods (including supermarket-bought and take-away like KFC, Maccas, etc)
Are there any issues about availability of food?
Do you have any worries about physical activity or screen time?
Document conversation about recommendations re physical activity, exercise and screen time
Physical activity, exercise and screen time

valueCoding.display: Environmental exposure to tobacco smoke (home, car, etc)

item.text:
Quantity and frequency of:
- alcohol
- caffeine (coffee, soft drinks, iced coffee)
- cannabis/yarndi/gunja
other substance use: IVDU, methamphetamine, opiates, solvents, other
Have you or someone close to you ever had issues with gambling?
Is there anything that you are worried about in relation to your sexual health?

Consider discussing as relevant to age/sex/gender:
- contraception
- menstruation
- sexually transmitted infection symptoms and screening
- blood-borne virus screening
- continence
- menopause
- erectile dysfunction
Check recommended primary vaccinations completed and provide catch-up if required

extension.valueString: Immunisations up to date and recorded on AIR

item.text: Immunisations up to date and recorded on Australian Immunisation Register (as per Australian Immunisation Handbook)?
Vaccines given today recorded on Australian Immunisation Register?
Immunisation (eligibility for funded vaccines may vary across jurisdictions)
Is there anything that you are worried about with your vision?
Is there anything that you are worried about with your hearing?
Is there anything that you are worried about with your teeth?
Document conversation about oral health and care of teeth
Full blood count, HbA1c or blood glucose level, serum lipids, Kidney function including eGFR, Liver function tests, ACR
Chlamydia, gonorrhoea: <=30, first void urine (male and female) and/or endocervical swab or self-administered vaginal swab (female) or throat and anal swab (men who have sex with men [MSM])
Syphilis (endemic areas, MSM, others at high risk)
Trichomoniasis (<=30, male and female, remote areas and other endemic areas, first void urine and/or endocervical swab or self-administered vaginal swab)
Blood-borne virus screening: HBV if status not known/not recorded on file, HCV if risk factors, HIV if risk factors
